newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: RHB Capital targets managing 10 bln rgt.
newsitem.headline: RHB Capital targets managing 10 bln rgt.

text.p: RHB Capital Bhd, formerly DCB Holdings Bhd, is aiming to manage 10 billion ringgit in assets after the launch of some new products in the near future, its chairman Abdul Rashid Hussain said.

"We will roll out new products to link up with asset management, which will take total funds (under RHB's management) to 10 billion ringgit, substantial in this part of the world," Rashid told reporters on Monday after a formal launch of RHB Capital.
He said RHB Capital, which is already the largest private fund manager in Malaysia, currently manages 2.7 billion ringgit in Malaysia and another 3.0 billion in Singapore.
RHB Capital, formerly DCB Holdings Bhd, has become one of Malaysia's biggest financial groups after a restructuring and merger with Kwong Yik Bank Bhd.
Rashid said asset management would not only stabilise the group's income but also contribute significantly to earnings.
"This is because we do not want to rely heavily on the stockbroking business, given its volatility.
"After the merger, we anticipate an asset management portfolio of between 7.0 billion and 8.0 billion ringgit," Rashid said.
Institutional business would continue to contribute a substantial part of the business, currently accounting for 59.3 percent of the total, he said.
